stock.model

Interface IPortfolio

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PortfolioImpl

    public interface IPortfolio
    This interface describes a single portfolio and operations that can be performed by a portfolio. A portfolio is a collection of shares of stocks, ETF, Mutual funds etc. that exist on the stock market.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(java.lang.String tickerSymbol, double amount, java.time.LocalDateTime date, double commissionFee)
      Add a stock to this portfolio with the given parameters.

      Returns a mapping of each stock and it's quantity held in the portfolio.
      java.lang.Double getCostBasis(java.time.LocalDateTime date)
      Returns the cost basis of the portfolio, i.e.
      java.lang.String getPortfolioName()
      Returns the name of the portfolio.
      java.lang.Double getValueByDate(java.time.LocalDateTime date)
      Returns the sum of current value of all the stocks in the portfolio on the given date.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(java.lang.String tickerSymbol,
         double amount,
         java.time.LocalDateTime date,
         double commissionFee)
        Add a stock to this portfolio with the given parameters. Stocks can only be added on weekdays and working days between trading hours of 8:00am to 4:00pm EDT.
        Parameters:
        tickerSymbol - the identifier symbol of the stock.
        amount - the amount of worth of stocks to be bought.
        date - the date on which the stocks are to be bought.

      • getPortfolioName

        java.lang.String getPortfolioName()
        Returns the name of the portfolio.
        Returns:
        the name of the portfolio as string.

      • getCostBasis

        java.lang.Double getCostBasis(java.time.LocalDateTime date)
        Returns the cost basis of the portfolio, i.e. the cost it took to buy all stocks in the portfolio.
        Returns:
        the amount it took to buy the contents of the portfolio.

      • getValueByDate

        java.lang.Double getValueByDate(java.time.LocalDateTime date)
        Returns the sum of current value of all the stocks in the portfolio on the given date.
        Parameters:
        date - the date on which the value is to be determined.
        Returns:
        the value of the portfolio as double.

      • getContentsOn

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> getContentsOn(java.time.LocalDateTime date)
        Returns a mapping of each stock and it's quantity held in the portfolio.
        Parameters:
        date - the date on which the contents are required.
        Returns:
        a map of stock symbol to quantity.
